ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot but it was much more work than advertised. Grading is much harsher.
By taking this class I was able to take my level of mandarin from beginners to intermediate. The class is very fast paced but a great experience overall
I learned a lot of charcters through the daily and nightly quizzes and improved my grammar immesely do the small class size.
I improved my Chinese speaking, listening, reading and writing abilities.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think assigning less exclusively listening vocab would be helpful. Then we could really focus and absorb the assigned material better.

The class was extremely personalized, which was great. My teachers really got to know me. I feel like there wasn't enough room to take risks -- we learn languages by making mistakes, but I feel that sometimes I had the incentive to speak in short, simple sentences, rather than test myself and use longer, more compelx ones.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only take this if you are serious about Chinese. This class will not go well if you are going to put in 50% effort
If a student is committed to spending lots of time on improving and is self-motivated to learn the language, then this course is right for them.
